title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical adventure novel about a shepherd boy’s journey to find treasure and discover his destiny. Filled with mystical insights and inspiring lessons about following one's dreams.

title: Inferno
author: Dan Brown
description: In this high-stakes thriller, Robert Langdon wakes in a Florence hospital with no memory and must follow Dante's clues to prevent a plague threatening the world, racing against time through historic art and symbolism.

title: Hunting Adeline: The First Hunt
author: H.D. Carlton
description: Adeline’s life is turned upside down as she becomes the target of a chilling obsession. This dark romance thriller explores the dangerous edges of love, power, and survival in a gripping, emotional tale full of twists and suspense.

title: Jurassic Park
author: Michael Crichton
description: A groundbreaking story where genetic engineering brings dinosaurs back to life on a remote island. Chaos ensues when the park's security systems fail, leading to thrilling adventures and life-or-death situations.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: Set in the racially charged American South, this novel explores themes of justice, morality, and innocence through the eyes of young Scout Finch. It's a timeless story about empathy and standing up for what's right.

title: Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance
author: Robert M. Pirsig
description: An exploration of philosophy, quality, and values disguised as a motorcycle road trip story. Pirsig reflects on life, technology, and the meaning of happiness in this unique and thought-provoking narrative.

title: Clash of Zealots
author: Reza Aslan
description: In a grim world ruled by fanatics and gods, a rebel priest must uncover the forgotten truths of ancient faiths to prevent a divine catastrophe. With relentless pacing and mythic world-building, this novel blends dark fantasy with themes of heresy, belief, and forbidden power in a truly haunting tale.

title: A Game of Thrones
author: George R.R. Martin
description: The first book in the epic 'A Song of Ice and Fire' series, full of political intrigue, battles, and dragons. It weaves a complex tale of power struggles, family loyalty, and survival in a richly imagined world.

title: To Catch a Thief
author: David Dodge
description: A suspenseful mystery novel featuring a reformed thief trying to clear his name from new crimes. Filled with twists and turns, it keeps readers guessing until the very end.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut stranded on Mars uses ingenuity and science to survive alone on a hostile planet. This novel combines thrilling survival adventure with scientific realism and humor.

title: Big Little Lies
author: Liane Moriarty
description: A story about three women whose seemingly perfect lives unravel to reveal secrets, lies, and betrayals. It explores themes of friendship, domestic abuse, and the complexities of human relationships.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: Between life and death, Nora finds herself in a library where each book leads to an alternate life. Can she find the one where she truly belongs?

title: Angels & Demons
author: Dan Brown
description: Prequel to The Da Vinci Code, this novel follows Robert Langdon as he investigates a secret society's plot to destroy the Vatican. Combining science, religion, and conspiracy, it offers intense thrills and mysteries.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A classic fantasy tale about Bilbo Baggins' journey with dwarves to reclaim a lost kingdom from the dragon Smaug. The story is filled with magic, danger, and courage, captivating readers of all ages.

title: Mythos
author: Stephen Fry
description: Stephen Fry brings Greek mythology to vibrant life with wit, insight, and deep affection for the material. From the creation of the world to the rise of Zeus, these retellings are accessible, clever, and enlightening—making ancient stories of gods, monsters, and heroes both engaging and culturally enriching for a modern audience.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian regime that controls every aspect of life, including truth and thought. Orwell's 1984 explores themes of surveillance, propaganda, and rebellion in a haunting and timeless story.

title: Born a Crime
author: Trevor Noah
description: A compelling memoir by comedian Trevor Noah about growing up during apartheid in South Africa. It’s both heartbreaking and humorous, shedding light on racial and social issues.

title: Treasure Island
author: Robert Louis Stevenson
description: A classic adventure novel about a young boy’s quest to find hidden pirate treasure. Full of suspense, mutiny, and memorable characters, this story has captivated readers for generations.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The classic vampire novel about Count Dracula’s move from Transylvania to England and the efforts of a small group to stop him. It defined the vampire myth and remains a staple of gothic horror literature.

title: The Red Pyramid
author: Rick Riordan
description: Siblings Carter and Sadie Kane accidentally unleash a powerful Egyptian god and must navigate a secret world of ancient magic and danger. Riordan’s signature style brings Egyptian mythology to life with humor, action, and family dynamics as the Kanes embrace their heritage and battle ancient forces threatening humanity.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: The classic epic poem detailing the final weeks of the Trojan War, focusing on the wrath of Achilles and the fateful battles between gods and mortals. It is a cornerstone of ancient literature that explores heroism, fate, and the cost of pride.

title: A Clash of Kings
author: George R.R. Martin
description: The second book in the epic saga 'A Song of Ice and Fire' that expands the complex political intrigue and war among noble families fighting for the Iron Throne, with dragons and magic slowly awakening.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: An inspiring memoir of a woman who grew up in a strict and isolated household in rural Idaho but eventually escapes through education, challenging family loyalty and transforming her identity through knowledge.

title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
description: The personal writings of Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, offering profound reflections on Stoic philosophy, virtue, leadership, and the nature of human existence, relevant through centuries.

title: Twilight
author: Stephenie Meyer
description: A modern vampire romance that follows Bella Swan's life-changing encounter with the mysterious Edward Cullen, mixing supernatural elements with teenage drama and suspense.

title: Hunting Adeline 2: Seduced
author: H.D. Carlton
description: The twisted continuation of Adeline's harrowing story, where obsession and passion collide, forcing her to navigate a dangerous web of love and survival, confronting dark secrets that threaten her sanity.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: An epic sci-fi saga set on the desert planet Arrakis, revolving around politics, religion, and ecology. The story follows Paul Atreides as he navigates power struggles and prophecies in a richly imagined universe.

title: Norse Mythology
author: Neil Gaiman
description: Neil Gaiman retells the Norse myths with poetic flair and deep humanity, bringing to life the gods, giants, and epic tales of Asgard, weaving ancient lore into captivating modern storytelling.

title: Franny and Zooey
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Two interconnected stories about the Glass siblings, exploring themes of spirituality, identity, and family. Salinger's characteristic prose captures the complexities of modern life and human emotion.

title: The Historian
author: Elizabeth Kostova
description: A young woman uncovers a dark secret hidden in ancient letters about Dracula. Her journey across Europe leads to a chilling confrontation with legends, lore, and undead truths.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A fascinating exploration of the history of humanity from the Stone Age to modern times. Harari combines science, anthropology, and history to provide a thought-provoking overview of human evolution and civilization.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A young boy survives a shipwreck and shares a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger. This imaginative and symbolic tale explores survival, faith, and the human spirit through a compelling narrative.

title: Into the Wild
author: Jon Krakauer
description: Based on a true story, the book chronicles the life of Chris McCandless, a young man who gave up everything to live in the Alaskan wilderness. Krakauer investigates his motives, philosophy, and tragic death, raising haunting questions about identity, freedom, and what it means to truly live.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem chronicling Odysseus’ long, perilous journey home after the Trojan War, filled with gods, monsters, and heroic trials. This cornerstone of Western literature explores themes of perseverance, cunning, and fate.

title: Origin
author: Dan Brown
description: Langdon is thrust into a race between faith and science when his billionaire friend unveils a discovery that will change the world, leading him across Spain to stop an extremist plot.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
description: A magical story centered around a mysterious traveling circus that appears without warning. Two young magicians are bound in a competition that tests love, loyalty, and fate in a mesmerizing tale.

title: Behind Her Eyes
author: Sarah Pinborough
description: A single mom enters a twisted love triangle with secrets that unravel reality itself. This gripping thriller shocks readers with one of the most unexpected endings in recent years.

title: The Lost Symbol
author: Dan Brown
description: Set in Washington D.C., Harvard symbologist Robert Langdon races to uncover a conspiracy involving the Freemasons after his mentor is kidnapped, navigating hidden rituals and ancient secrets that could reshape America’s destiny.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A gripping thriller involving symbology, secret societies, and hidden messages in famous artworks. Robert Langdon's race against time to unravel the mysteries leads to shocking revelations about history and religion.

title: Dark Matter
author: Blake Crouch
description: Jason Dessen is abducted and wakes in a world not his own. As he struggles to return to his life, he realizes how far science—and the human mind—can truly go.
